issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.customfield_12310192: The configuration dfs.secondary.https.port has been renamed to dfs.namenode.secondary.https-port for consistency. The old configuration is still supported via a deprecation path.

fields.summary: HA: Shared edits dir property should be suffixed with nameservice and namenodeID

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.summary: Fix cluster setup docs for correct SNN HTTPS parameters

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: An improvement or enhancement to an existing feature or task.
issuetype.name: Improvement

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

fields.description: This config was mistakenly left out of the NAMESERVICE_SPECIFIC_KEY map, which makes it tougher to configure federated clusters with security.
fields.summary: Secondary NN HTTPS address should be listed as a NAMESERVICE_SPECIFIC_KEY

comments.body:
Attached patch adds it to the array mentioned above. Also:
- properly adds it to 
DFSConfigKeys.java
- sets a new default (previously was 443 which an unprivileged process can't bind anyway)
- changes the config key to match the naming convention of other 2NN configs
- deprecates the old config pointing to the new one

-1 overall.  Here are the results of testing the latest attachment 
  http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/attachment/12514577/hdfs-2950.txt
  against trunk revision .

    +1 @author.  The patch does not contain any @author tags.

    -1 tests included.  The patch doesn't appear to include any new or modified tests.
                        Please justify why no new tests are needed for this patch.
                        Also please list what manual steps were performed to verify this patch.

    +1 javadoc.  The javadoc tool did not generate any warning messages.

    +1 javac.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of javac compiler warnings.

    +1 eclipse:eclipse.  The patch built with eclipse:eclipse.

    +1 findbugs.  The patch does not introduce any new Findbugs (version 1.3.9) warnings.

    +1 release audit.  The applied patch does not increase the total number of release audit warnings.

    +1 core tests.  The patch passed unit tests in .

    +1 contrib tests.  The patch passed contrib unit tests.

Test results: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/1869//testReport/
Console output: https://builds.apache.org/job/PreCommit-HDFS-Build/1869//console

This message is automatically generated.
